title: Safe Greeting
description: Write a function that takes a nullable name and returns a greeting, using the Elvis operator to provide a default.
instructions: Write a function greet(name: String?) that returns 'Hello, <name>!' or 'Hello, Guest!' if name is null. Print greetings for both 'Alice' and null.

hints.text: Use the Elvis operator ?: to provide a default value
The parameter type should be String? (nullable)
name ?: "Guest" gives you name or Guest if null

commonMistakes.consequence: Cannot pass null to the function

commonMistakes.mistake: Using if/else instead of Elvis operator
Forgetting to handle the null case
